description: A direct tax on individuals, HUFs, partnerships, and corporations, governed by the Income Tax Act, 1961.
keyFeatures: Types: Individual, Corporate, Progressive. Filing and Compliance: Taxpayers file annual returns based on income and applicable slabs.

description: An indirect tax replacing multiple central and state taxes, unifying the tax system for goods and services in India.
keyFeatures: Types: GST Slabs (5%, 12%, 18%, 28%), Input Tax Credit (ITC), Compliance.

description: Levied on profits earned by companies in India, with rates varying based on company size and type.
keyFeatures: Rate variations, Minimum Alternate Tax (MAT) for certain companies.

description: Indirect tax on import and export of goods and services, regulating trade, protecting domestic industries, and generating revenue.
keyFeatures: Types: Basic Customs Duty, Additional Customs Duty (CVD), Special Additional Customs Duty (SAD).

description: Indirect tax on manufacturing or production of goods within India, now mostly replaced by GST.
keyFeatures: Included in product price, relevance reduced with GST implementation.

description: Indirect tax on specified services, replaced by GST in 2017.
keyFeatures: Replaced by GST as the primary tax on services.

description: Municipal tax levied on property owners for the maintenance of local civic amenities.
Direct tax on an individual's net wealth, abolished in 2015 due to administrative complexities.
keyFeatures: Abolished due to administrative challenges and limited revenue impact.

description: Levied on profit from the sale of assets like property and investments.
keyFeatures: Types: Short-term and long-term gains based on asset holding period.

description: Tax on the purchase and sale of securities to regulate and discourage speculative trading in the stock market.
keyFeatures: Aims to control excessive speculation in the securities market.

description: Pre-GST, states imposed VAT on goods within their jurisdiction.
keyFeatures: Rates varied by state and were levied at different stages of the supply chain.

description: Levied by state governments on motor vehicles during registration, funding road infrastructure.
keyFeatures: Revenue used for development and maintenance of roads.

description: Levied by state governments on individuals earning income through a profession, trade, or employment.
keyFeatures: Rates vary by state, deducted by employers from employees' salaries.
